sentences.english: Lars used to say that ninety percent of Saunière’s story is fiction.
sentences.chinese: 佬司常说尚尼亚故事的百分子九十是杜撰的。

sentences.english: Scholars suspect the story of Archimedes isn't even entirely true.
sentences.chinese: 学者们怀疑，阿基米德的故事可能出于杜撰。

sentences.english: The Guardian tells the grim tale.
sentences.chinese: 卫报杜撰了这个悲惨的故事。

sentences.english: Myth is a term we use to refer to a traditional story.
sentences.chinese: 我们经常用杜撰故事来讲那些传统事件。

sentences.english: My mother colluded in the myth of him as the swanky businessman .
sentences.chinese: 我母亲和别人串通，把他杜撰成一个阔气的商人。

sentences.english: "The media coined the term flash mobs, " Ramsey added.
sentences.chinese: 媒体杜撰了快闪党这个词，“拉姆齐补充说。”

sentences.english: The old drunk, of course - the other 3 are mythical creatures.
sentences.chinese: 当然非酒鬼莫属，其他三个都是杜撰出来的。

sentences.english: This time, though, the truth was more powerful than fiction.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这一次，事实比杜撰更加有力。

sentences.english: Much data in the Indian media is planted by the China lovers the Jews.
sentences.chinese: 印度媒体报道的很多数据是中国的基友犹太人杜撰的。

definition: to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to compile/to draw up/to fabricate/to invent/to concoct/to make up/to cook up
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
facing a wall, an imaginary construction (idiom); baseless fabrication
